message: A converted motel on the Crow Creek Sioux Reservation in South Dakota is helping victims of sex trafficking thanks to the efforts of Lisa Heth and Wiconi Wawokiy. Although she'd long wanted to create programming and a shelter to serve Native American victims of sex trafficking, buying a decaying 1970s motel was definitely not part of her dream.

data.description: Lisa Heth bought a rundown motel and transformed it into a shelter for sex trafficking victims, Mary Annette Pember reports.
data.title: Mary Annette Pember: New center offers support for victims of sex trafficking
